name: Focus Pull Stagger
description: Staggered entrance with blur-to-sharp + scale pull. Elements go from blurred/slightly scaled down to sharp/full size with 180ms intervals between siblings.
when_to_use: Card/row stagger entrances in cinematic demos
ai_guidance: Signature cinematic-dark entrance. Use with data-focus-group attribute and engine.runFocusStagger(). Requires 4-tier speed hierarchy context. Pairs with clip-path wipe phase transitions.

name: Typewriter Reveal
description: Character-by-character text reveal with cursor, simulating typing. 28-50ms per character depending on content length.
ai_guidance: Use for text that appears to be 'typed' — AI suggestions, search queries, renamed files. Speed: 28ms/char for short text, 50ms/char for longer. Works in both cinematic-dark and editorial personalities.

name: Self-Drawing Checkmarks
description: SVG polyline checkmarks that draw themselves using stroke-dashoffset animation. 200ms stagger between multiple checkmarks.
ai_guidance: Cinematic-dark completion primitive. Use SVG polyline with stroke-dasharray set to path length. Trigger by removing stroke-dashoffset. Stagger multiple checks with 200ms intervals.

name: Multi-File Progress
description: Animated progress bars for multi-file processing visualization. Each bar fills independently with linear easing over the phase dwell time.
ai_guidance: Use during processing/upload phases in cinematic demos. Progress bars always use linear easing (never ease-out). Stagger start times for multiple files to create visual rhythm. Pair with step-dot progress indicators.

name: Slide + Fade Stagger
description: Elements slide up 10px while fading in, with 120ms stagger intervals between siblings. The editorial signature entrance.
ai_guidance: Default editorial entrance. Use with data-stagger-group attribute and engine.runSlideStagger(). Stagger timing: 80-150ms between siblings, 400-600ms per element. No blur, no 3D — just translateY + opacity.

name: Blur-to-Sharp Reveal
description: Elements transition from blurred to sharp focus over 600-800ms. Reserved for hero moments and key statistics in editorial personality.
ai_guidance: Editorial hero-only primitive. Do NOT use for general content items — reserve for one or two key moments per demo. Use engine.runBlurReveal() method. Content items should use ed-slide-stagger instead.

name: Content Cycling
description: Crossfades between multiple content variations in a fixed container. Shows different use cases for a single feature. 2.5-3.5s per cycle item.

css_properties.item: position: absolute; inset: 0; opacity: 0; transition: opacity var(--ed-medium) var(--ed-ease-out)

ai_guidance: The editorial signature effect. Use engine.runContentCycle() method. Each cycle item gets text + optional icon/image. Crossfade between items with --ed-medium timing. Cycle interval: 2.5-3.5s per item. Container must have fixed dimensions.

name: Animated Number Count
description: Numbers animate from 0 to target value with ease-out deceleration. Duration scales with magnitude — small numbers faster, large numbers 800ms.
when_to_avoid: Decorative numbers that don't represent data
ai_guidance: Use engine.runCountUp() method. Animate using requestAnimationFrame with ease-out-quad interpolation. Format numbers appropriately (commas, decimals, units). Works in both editorial and neutral-light personalities.

name: Tab Highlight + Crossfade
description: Tab selection with highlight indicator transition and content panel crossfade. CSS transition-based, not keyframe animation.
ai_guidance: Editorial interaction primitive. Use engine.runTabSwitch() or CSS transitions directly. Tab highlight slides between tabs (FAST tier), content panel crossfades (MEDIUM tier). Two distinct speed tiers create visual hierarchy.

name: Slide + Fade Stagger (Light)
description: Elements slide up 8px while fading in with 150ms stagger intervals. Neutral-light variant — slightly less vertical travel than editorial (8px vs 10px).
ai_guidance: Default neutral-light entrance. Use with data-slide-group attribute and engine.runSlideStagger(). No blur effects — tutorials should feel sharp and clear from frame 1. Slightly less travel than editorial (8px vs 10px).

name: Simulated Cursor
description: Animated SVG arrow cursor that moves to target coordinates over 600ms. Simulates user interaction for tutorial walkthroughs.

css_properties.movement: transition: left var(--nl-medium) var(--nl-ease-out), top var(--nl-medium) var(--nl-ease-out)

ai_guidance: Neutral-light tutorial primitive. Cursor moves from current position to target element coordinates. Often paired with nl-spotlight. Use engine cursor methods with target element selectors. SVG arrow cursor, not default pointer.

name: Element Spotlight
description: Semi-transparent overlay with a cutout around the target element. Draws focus to a specific UI area during tutorials. 2000ms typical display time.

css_properties.overlay: position: absolute; inset: 0; background: rgba(0,0,0,0.4); z-index: 50
css_properties.cutout: box-shadow: 0 0 0 9999px rgba(0,0,0,0.4); border-radius: 8px; border: 2px solid var(--nl-accent)

when_to_use: Drawing attention to specific UI areas
ai_guidance: Neutral-light tutorial primitive. Creates overlay with cutout around target element. Often paired with nl-cursor-to and nl-tooltip. Transition the spotlight position between steps using --nl-ease-out easing. Display each spotlight for 2-3 seconds.

name: Step Indicator Update
description: Numbered horizontal dots with connector lines showing progress through a multi-step tutorial. Active dot scales up and gets accent color.

css_properties.dot: width: 28px; height: 28px; border-radius: 50%; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center

ai_guidance: Neutral-light tutorial primitive. Horizontal layout: dot-connector-dot-connector-dot. Active dot scales up and gets --nl-accent color. Completed dots get --nl-success. Use engine step methods to advance through steps.

name: Fade In
description: Universal opacity fade from 0 to 1. The simplest entrance primitive, works with any personality.
when_to_use: Fallback when no personality-specific entrance fits
ai_guidance: Universal fallback entrance. Prefer personality-specific entrances (cd-focus-stagger, ed-slide-stagger, nl-slide-stagger) when a personality is active. Use fade-in only for elements that don't need personality-specific motion.

name: Fade Out
description: Universal opacity fade from 1 to 0. The simplest exit primitive, works with any personality.
ai_guidance: Universal fallback exit. Slightly faster than fade-in (300ms vs 400ms) because exits should feel snappier. Add pointer-events: none after fade completes to prevent ghost clicks.

name: Scale Entrance
description: Elements scale from 1.15 to 1.0 while fading in, with 100ms stagger intervals. The montage signature entrance — punchy and immediate.
ai_guidance: Signature montage entrance. Use with data-stagger-group attribute and engine.runScaleEntrance(). Items scale down from 1.15 to 1.0 with expo-out easing. Stagger at 80-120ms for rapid rhythm.

name: Hard Cut
description: Instant phase swap with zero animation. The outgoing phase disappears and incoming phase appears in a single frame. Maximum impact.
ai_guidance: Montage phase transition. Instant swap — no animation time. Use for maximum impact between contrasting scenes. Configure per-phase in MontageEngine: { transition: 'hard-cut' }. Mix with whip-wipes for rhythm.

name: Whip-Wipe Transition
description: 250ms directional clip-path wipe in four directions (left, right, up, down). Carries momentum between scenes. Montage's directional transition.
ai_guidance: Montage directional transition. 250ms clip-path inset wipe in four directions. Configure per-phase: { transition: 'whip-left' | 'whip-right' | 'whip-up' | 'whip-down' }. Mix with hard-cuts for rhythm variation.

name: Stat Reveal Pop
description: Stat card entrance with scale overshoot (0.8→1.05→1.0) and auto-triggered count-up animation. 150ms stagger between cards.
ai_guidance: Montage stat primitive. Cards pop in with scale overshoot, then numbers auto-count-up. Use engine.runStatReveal() which staggers cards at 150ms and auto-triggers runCountUp() after all cards are visible.

name: Text Hero Entrance
description: Full-screen typography scale entrance from 1.5 to 1.0. Used for title cards and closing CTAs. The montage hero moment.
ai_guidance: Montage hero typography primitive. Scale from 1.5 to 1.0 with expo-out. Use engine.runTextHero(selector). Apply .text-hero class to elements. Reserve for title cards and CTAs — max 2-3 uses per reel.

name: Grid Reveal
description: Fast tile stagger for 2×3 feature grids. 80ms interval between tiles, slide+fade entrance. Proves variety and feature abundance.
ai_guidance: Montage grid primitive. Fast tile stagger at 80ms intervals using slide+fade. Use engine.runGridReveal(groupName, 80). Best with 2×3 grid layout (6 tiles). Creates rapid rhythm showing feature abundance.

name: Split-Screen Reveal
description: Side-by-side panel reveal. Left panel slides in from left, right panel follows 200ms later from right. Feature comparison layout.
ai_guidance: Montage comparison primitive. Two panels slide in from opposite sides with 200ms stagger. Use engine.runSplitScreen('#left', '#right', 200). Apply .split-panel class. Great for showing two complementary features.

name: Camera Truck
description: Horizontal camera slide left or right, simulating a truck move on a dolly track. Translates scene on X axis up to 250px.
ai_guidance: Cinematic lateral slide. Max displacement 250px per camera-guardrails.json. Use with perspective rig container. Pairs well with phase transitions to reveal adjacent content panels.

name: Camera Pedestal
description: Vertical camera rise or lower, simulating a pedestal move. Translates scene on Y axis up to 150px.
ai_guidance: Cinematic vertical camera move. Max displacement 150px per camera-guardrails.json. Simulates physical camera rising on a pedestal mount. Good for dramatic vertical reveals.

name: Camera Crane
description: Combined vertical rise with slight tilt, simulating a crane shot. Translates Y up to 180px with subtle rotateX for parallax depth.
ai_guidance: Most dramatic vertical camera move. Combines translateY with slight rotateX tilt for crane parallax. Max Y displacement 180px per camera-guardrails.json. Reserve for high-impact phase transitions.

name: Camera Arc
description: Orbital rotation around the scene on the Y axis, simulating a camera arc. Rotates up to 20 degrees.
ai_guidance: Rotational camera move around the Y axis. Max rotation 20deg per camera-guardrails.json. Creates dramatic 3D perspective shift. Requires perspective rig container for proper depth rendering.

name: Camera Push-In
description: Forward camera movement toward the scene, simulating a push-in. Translates on Z axis up to 120px for an approaching feel.
ai_guidance: Forward Z-axis camera move. Max displacement 120px per camera-guardrails.json. Creates sense of approaching and focusing on subject. Lighter alternative to ct-camera-dolly.

name: Camera Pull-Out
description: Backward camera movement away from the scene, simulating a pull-out. Translates on negative Z axis up to 150px with slight scale reduction.
ai_guidance: Reverse Z-axis camera move with slight scale reduction. Max displacement 150px per camera-guardrails.json. Creates sense of pulling back to see the bigger picture. Good for context-expanding transitions.

name: Rack Focus
description: Simulated rack focus effect alternating between sharp and blurred states. Toggles blur filter up to 4px to shift visual attention between foreground and background.
ai_guidance: Cinematic focus shift effect. Max blur 4px per camera-guardrails.json. Alternates between blur(0) and blur(3px). Use sparingly — excessive blur is disorienting. Listed in blur_primitives array for guardrail enforcement.

name: Handheld Drift
description: Continuous subtle random jitter simulating a handheld camera. Applies tiny random translateX/Y offsets up to 1.2px via requestAnimationFrame.

css_properties.scene: transform: translateX(±1.2px) translateY(±1.2px) — applied per frame via rAF

when_to_use: Adding organic feel to static scenes
ai_guidance: Continuous rAF-based jitter. Max displacement 1.2px per camera-guardrails.json. Extremely subtle — adds organic camera feel without distracting. Use on long-dwell cinematic phases (>5s). Clean up with cancelAnimationFrame.

name: Camera Shake
description: Short burst of rapid random translation simulating a camera shake. Applies ±3px random offsets over 600ms then settles to rest.

css_properties.scene: transform: translateX(±3px) translateY(±3px) — burst applied via setTimeout steps

ai_guidance: Attention-seeking shake burst. Max displacement 3px per camera-guardrails.json. Forbidden in editorial and neutral-light personalities. Use once per demo maximum — overuse is disorienting. Settles to transform: none after burst.

name: Subtle Push-In
description: Extremely subtle scale increase from 1.0 to 1.01 over 2 seconds, simulating a barely-perceptible camera push-in for editorial contexts.
ai_guidance: Editorial-safe camera move. Max scale change 1% per camera-guardrails.json. No 3D transforms, no blur — just a tiny scale shift. The most restrained camera primitive. Use for editorial hero moments where any movement helps.

name: Camera Drift
description: Continuous extremely subtle horizontal oscillation of ±0.5px, simulating barely-perceptible camera drift for editorial scenes.

css_properties.scene: transform: translateX(±0.5px) — sinusoidal oscillation via rAF

when_to_use: Adding life to static editorial scenes
Long dwell phases in editorial demos
ai_guidance: Editorial-safe continuous ambient motion. Max displacement 0.5px per camera-guardrails.json. Sinusoidal oscillation via rAF. Almost imperceptible but adds organic feel. Only use on scenes >10s per editorial personality boundaries.
